title: simplify Xcode projects

milestone.title: v0.1
milestone.description: Support collaborator configuration; transition to GitHub

body:
*Xcode project files are fragile and easily corrupted.  According to forum discussions, corrupted project files sometimes require rebuilding from scratch, and contain information that is not saved elsewhere.*
*The problem is compounded by version control, since any change to the files or settings of a project causes the project to be changed, and therefore possibly subject to merge conflicts. This is of particular concern for Punkin, which has an Artist collaborator.*
*We set the git attributes for project files to `merge=union`, which helps but does not solve the problem.*

see  [Merging Xcode project files](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/4022362/merging-xcode-project-files), [Google example config files](http://code.google.com/p/google-toolbox-for-mac/source/browse/trunk/XcodeConfig/)

title: convert scripts ccInstall and archive to Python
body:
* *Python appears a better choice for producing robust, testable shell scripts; see also #18 "clean up UNIX error handling"*
* *Python also is used to customize LLDB, and has the capability to be extended in embedded in a way that looks practical as a way to replace the Rez language as a way to define Slates in Accessor.*
* *Cdoc html files were placed in a separate folder to accommodate ccInstall's limitations. Those files are now harder to preview because the source folder has a different structure from the target site.*

title: migrate Cdoc from HTML/sed to Markdown
body:
###### *Current Cdoc: existing in-house system for producing website for technical documentation*
* *created several years ago to simplify some aspects, especially accessibility features, for our in-house documentation*
* *currently uses a `sed`-based mechanism for expanding special features; JavaScript would be better*
* *current Cdoc history files do not scale well, especially for multiple developers, and represent a large investment in attempting to track what we're doing, with limited success*

###### *Markdown: publicly-available perl script to produce web content from readable text files*
* *much simpler and more collaborator-friendly*
* *can contain embedded HTML*
* *translators are available to convert markdown to HTML and HTML to markdown*
* *GitHub uses `markdown` for text rendering; Cdoc uses HTML. For collaborator-friendly editing, `markdown` provides a huge advantage compared with HTML.*

##### Conclusion
* History files: simplify and adapt toward simpler content to synchronize with Issues; see issue #3
* over time, implement special features in css and JavaScript for Markdown as well as `sed` translation
    * Markdown files can include HTML content, but Cdoc HTML features will be supported only from Cdoc HTML files
* eventually, convert existing Cdoc source to markdown
    * see [Markdown Tools][mdTools] and/or Markdownify for conversion from HTML

[mdTools]: http://brettterpstra.com/projects/markdown-service-tools
[markdownCdocNotes]: #MarkdownCdoc

title: modernize Objective-C
body:
adopt C++ 11
warnings and analyzer preferences
see WWCD2012:405 - Modern Objective-C, :413 - Migrating to Modern Objective-C

title: testing: adopt a code coverage tool
implement Private Categories
body:
Use Category Private, in a separate header included in both implementation and unit test files, to support Unit Testing while keeping private information private. See [Unit testing of private methods in Xcode](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/1098550/unit-testing-of-private-methods-in-xcode)
See also #9

title: organize Objective-C code consistently
body: see [Code Organization in Xcode Projects](http://akosma.com/2009/07/28/code-organization-in-xcode-projects/) (akosma), #10

title: establish stronger compiler error recognition
body:
enable recognition of most compiler errors; treat warnings as errors
see [Objective-C Compiler Warnings](http://akosma.com/2009/07/16/objective-c-compiler-warnings/), and [Confusing Objective-C Warnings and Errors](http://www.cocoawithlove.com/2009/04/8-confusing-objective-c-warnings-and.html) for additional advice

title: establish Objective-C coding  standards
body:
*We now have enough experience with Objective-C to have an idea which advice to take.*

* Establish initial standards; [akosma](http://wiki.akosma.com/Objective-C_Code_Standards) is probably a good starting point.
    * Use Category Private, in a separate header included in both implementation and unit test files, to support Unit Testing while keeping private information private. See [Unit testing of private methods in Xcode](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/1098550/unit-testing-of-private-methods-in-xcode)

[O'Reilly Webcast: Developing Effective OCUnit and UI Automation Testing for iOS](http://m.youtube.com/watch?v=5SycebOn7iY&desktop_uri=%2Fwatch%3Fv%3D5SycebOn7iY) (Code coverage at 21:20)

Support_v0_1.md for work on milestone v0.1; probably also includes bugfix versions 0.1.1, etc.* - [ ] create new issues for future plans from existing History.html files see also #19 migrate from HTML/sed to Markdown for further Markdown work

title: resolve User assumptions in Xcode builds

milestone.title: v0.1
milestone.description: Support collaborator configuration; transition to GitHub

body:
* *assumptions about locations of key folders including $DEV, $CCDev, $HOME*
* *assumption that Xcode projects can access variables defined in launchd configuration*

```
Previous support for global environment variables used file Environment.plist, which is no longer read.
Apparently, no new method of supporting custom environment variables for Xcode is as yet officially supported. (Other applications, including Terminal recognize user's config file in $HOME, which is more accessible.
Current workaround uses file /private/etc/launchd.conf, which is difficult to support, especially for collaborators, because it requires sudo access.
```
### ${CCDev}: address for folder of scripts, derived files, etc.
*location had been user-configurable via user definitions in Developer_Setup*
- [x] move folder to ~/Library and enter path directly in Xcode

- [x] correct merge conflicts (Punkin; Accessor)
*problem introduced at last merge by following bad internet advice to use `merge -i`*

### functions $(DEV), $(CCDev)
- [x] remove references to deprecated functions; remove function definitions

### ${DEV}: used to build a parameter to custom build scripts
- [x] change `ccInstallAction` parameters to use ${SRCROOT} instead of ${DEV} (Support; Punkin; Accessor)

### ${HOME}
- [x] remove all occurrences of `carolclark` from build specifications, most scripts (Support; Punkin; Accessor)

### refactor to correct $FPATH issue
- [x] #5 replace ksh $FPATH calls with dot syntax

### deprecated scripts
- [x] replace uses of deprecated scripts doxygenBuild, buildCdoc (see carolclark/Punkin#1, carolclark/Accessor#1)

### refactor ccInstall
- [x] file ccInstall.ksh: move from $CCDev/func to $CCDev/bin
- [ ] change ccInstall to take same parameters as ccInstallAction
    * *Then: is ccInstallAction still necessary?*

### ccInstallAction targets
- [ ] ?? if necessary: change calling syntax to use /bin/ksh as build tool, pass command as argument

### launchd configuration
- [ ] remove file `/private/etc/launchd.conf` from scripts and disk
